data.title: Delicious Korean food, great location, nice service
data.text: This is a nice place to visit for Korean food.  I like to get the bi bim bap. They also serve fusion dishes,  which is fun.  You can sit on the patio or inside.  The owners and servers are nice.  It is fun to walk around at the park after a meal.

data.title: Where's the beef?
data.text: I must admit I was disappointed with this place. Not that it was bad, it was just typical Korean food with mostly noodles, very little meat at a high price. Having said that, the service was excellent and the outdoor seating was nice.

data.title: Trying a new restaurant
data.text: Big Ohs is by far,the BEST Korean restaurant in Huntsville,AL. Everything from first walking in the door,to being seated to ordering our food and so forth was a welcoming and absolutely wonderful experience. We will definitely be eating here more often.

data.title: Late birthday dinner celebrations
data.text: Everything was GREAT! From the beginning to the end of our visit was AWESOME.Everyone made us feel welcome and were very attentive to us.Food is amazing here and we will be eating here frequently☺

data.title: Great Korean grub!
data.text: If you like Korean food and are in the downtown area, this is a GREAT little spot!  Very reasonably priced, too!

data.title: Just like Soul
data.text: Authentic Korean food, good service, good prices.  Both indoor and outdoor seating.  Make sure to order their "Sangria"!

data.title: Easy to walk past but don't
data.text: This is currently my "go to" place in Huntsville and I here pretty frequently. I have never had a bad dish here but the Korean Short Ribs are the best. Very friendly and great service.

data.title: Excellent food and service!
data.text: I've been 5 times since I first went last month, it's that good. I've had several of their dishes but my favorite is the spicy pork! They are also some of the nicest people and make sure you're well taken care of. I'll definitely be a regular here.

data.title: Tasty Korean food near Von Braun Center
data.text: While looking for a restaurant near Von Braun Center, we decided to try this place.  Very friendly owners, I had delicious yakimandu (fried dumplings) with tender and savory Korean BBQ chicken.  Everyone was happy with their food.  It was nice to be away from the traffic and long waits on University Dr. We will definitely come again when we are in the area

data.title: Korean dinner
data.text: Dining options are outside, upstairs and at the counter. Since it's hot here in the south right now we chose inside at the counter. It was interesting watching the Korean cooks hurriedly put together dinners. We ordered Korean Ramyon bowl and Beef and Leaf. Both were entrees but the Beef and Leaf was quite a small serving of bulgogi so it was more of an appetizer. It is bulgogi served on lettuce topped with almonds and a very spicy dipping sauce. The flavor was good and the meat tender. The Ramyon bowl was a large bowl of Asian noodles in chicken broth with onion, carrots, and cheese. We chose chicken for the added meat instead of pork. It was slightly spicy and very well done. This dish would be perfect for vegetarians. Overall the meal was exceptional.

data.title: Outstanding
data.text: The Bulgogi Burger is one of the best burgers I've had.  The service is great and the people are so friendly.  They have a nice area to eat upstairs and great lunch specials.  This place is worth checking out!

data.title: Fresh Food, Friendly Service
data.text: I've been to Big O's several times now and thought it was time to share this gem with the rest of the world.  This is a family owned and operated restaurant on the Square next to Amendment XXI and Sam & Greg's.  I cannot speak for the authenticity of the cuisine; but, I can tell you, everything I've ordered has been fresh and delicious.  I particularly like the Seafood Pancake, an appetizer that can serve as a main course. (there is no batter or syrup, it is MUCH better than it sounds).  Be adventuresome, you won't regret it.

data.title: Great Asian Bistro in downtown Huntsville
data.text: Great Asian Bistro in downtown Huntsville friendly staff, tasty food, nice outside tables,  Korean food, craft beer. Worth a visit......

data.title: Korean dinner
data.text: Excellent Korean food. Close to the best  I've ever had. Food arrived timely and the portions were nice sized. The bulgogi and jap hae with glass noodles were both excellent. They were served with sticky rice, fried dumplings and were preceded with a salad with an excellent homemade ginger sesame dressing. The cabbage and cucumber kimchi were both good. We ate outside which was typical outdoor seating but the restaurant does offer inside seating that is supposedly nicer. Our only complaint was the final bill which seemed a little steep for the entrees although bulgogi is a pricier item.

data.title: Not a big fan of Korean food
data.text: I went because a friend wanted to go and I tried a few things. Not sure what some of it was but it was all tasty and spicy. Service was excellent and fast. Will probably go back again.

data.title: Very Good
data.text: I had the bulgogi and the bibimbap. They were got very tasty and I would order them again. They had a neat Korean rice wine on the menu that I thought tasted like peanuts, but the other person in my party said it was more of an herb flavor. It was just alright.

data.title: Good Korean Food
data.text: I was very glad to see a Korean restaurant open up downtown, its definitely one of my favorite cuisines. Big Oh's did not disappoint. The food was very tasty and the portions were pretty big. My wife and I started with a bacon kimchi pancake and wings. The wings were particularly good, and both appetizers were large enough for two people to share. We went with some Korean classics for our entrees, bulgogi and bibimbap. Both were spot on with the flavors you would come to expect from Korean food. Both entrees also came with fried dumplings, which were also pretty good.

data.title: Great wings and food!
data.text:
My office is near here and I have been here several times.  Their wings (Big Oh Special sauce) are the best wings anywhere!  It is very different and very good!

I have also eaten 4 other entrees and they have all been great and different change of pace.  It has several different options so there is something there for a wide variety of taste.

The owners are very nice and helpful and the service is very quick.

data.title: Best Korean food outside of Korea!
data.text:
Delicious, authentic, Korean cuisine in a lovely old cafe in downtown Huntsville.  Superb service, clean, comfortable and affordable.  If you want the "real thing" give Big Oh's
a try.  Kimchi is home made and reflects that made in the Seoul area.  Hot but not
blistering hot.
